Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West - Lincoln, Nebraska | UDisc Disc Golf Course Directory UDisc Logo UDisc Logo Play Learn Grow disc golf Log in Open main menu United States / Nebraska / Lincoln Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West Lincoln, Nebraska 4.2 ( 1423 ratings ) Lincoln, Nebraska 4.2 ( 1423 ratings ) About the course Layouts Reviews Leaderboard 1h 30m Estimated time Est. time 2.5mi Estimated length Est. length Mostly flat Elevation Elevation Moderate Hard Show layout maps Before you go Restricted hours 5:00am - 11:00pm Good conditions 9 hours ago About the course The oldest disc golf course in Nebraska.  Stretch out the arm at Roper West with three tees per hole; short (red), medium (blue) and long (gold). The course was redesigned in 2016 from 27 holes with one tee to 18 with three tees.

Water fountain and restrooms are closed during the winter season.

Course designer - Dominic Sawtelle
Tee signs - James Fleege
Course management - Lincoln Flying Disc Club Show more 18 holes Concrete Tees Veteran Targets Mixed use Public park Dogs allowed Cart friendly No drinking water available Restroom available Stroller friendly Limited mobility/cane accessible Paved trail runs throughout the course. Handicap accessible parking available. Roper - East 0.3 mi 4.1 Scott Whitcomb Memorial [Tierra Park] 6.1 mi 4.0 Bethany Beginners Disc Golf Course 4.8 mi Stores Show on map 3.8 Play it Again Sports 3.8 mi Follow course maps with the UDisc app Scan with your mobile device Reviews Show all Upkeep 4.3 Shot variety/design 3.9 Tee areas 4.3 Signage/wayfinding 4.1 Amenities 3.2 Scenery/views 3.6 @ mattyk9 276 Jul 31, 2025 Very glad we stopped to play here. This is a longer park style course that makes good use of the available trees and elevation. Feels very different from Beal Slough, I would love to have both of those courses closer. @ alexhallumsdisc 310 May 30, 2025 Solid 18 hole track. Multiple concrete tee-pads on every hole. Nice fun of shot shapes & distances. Park-style golf with lots of mature trees & grassy fairways. Good use of elevation. Worth a visit if you’re in the area or looking for something new! @ bckcntryskr 727 May 18, 2025 Boring and noisy. The new T pads were poured too skinny. Nearby courses Nearby stores Frequently asked questions How do I get to Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West? You can get directions to Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West by clicking Get Directions , which will open your device's map application with the disc golf course location. The disc golf course is located at 40.848690074846125, -96.71505813570042 in Lincoln, Nebraska . Do I need to pay to play disc golf at Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West? Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West is free to play! Just show up and enjoy the disc golf course. What is the difficulty and length of Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West? Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West has 18 disc golf holes and has a difficulty rating of " Moderate " and " Hard " . The typical disc golf round at Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West takes about 2 hour s and covers approximately 2.5 miles ( 4.0 km). How highly rated is Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West by the disc golf community? Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West has an average rating of 4.2 out of 5 stars based on 1423 community reviews . This is considered a very good course rating by the disc golf community. What amenities are available at Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West? Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West offers the following amenities: 18 disc golf holes, restrooms, cart-friendly paths, pet-friendly areas, stroller-friendly paths . When is the best time to play at Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West? Upgrade to UDisc Pro to see detailed course traffic patterns and find the best times to play disc golf here. How can I track my disc golf round at Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West? You can track your disc golf round using the UDisc mobile app. If on your phone, click the "Start a Round" button at the bottom of this page to begin navigating Max E. Roper Interstate Park - West and tracking your disc golf round. The app provides GPS-enabled disc golf hole maps, scorekeeping, and stats tracking. Upgrade to UDisc Pro for advanced features like detailed statistics and course traffic information. Start a round Get directions The App for Disc Golfers. About – Landscapes Golf Management Skip to content Toggle navigation About Our Mission Our vision Our History Our Values Our Team Our Properties Golf Management Accounting & HR Agronomy Food & Beverage Golf Operations Marketing Purchasing Sales Technology Select Services Case Studies FAQs GET IN TOUCH About Landscapes Golf Management 30+ Years of Operational Excellence About Our Mission We have a passion for golf, for creating market-leading operations, and for developing the best leaders in golf management. Our vision We aim to be the most trusted and influential golf management company. Our History Our story begins organically in the 1980s as Landscapes Unlimited grew from a golf development company into owning and operating a portfolio of 20+ courses and clubs. In 2007, we began offering our expertise to owners outside the Landscapes portfolio, and Landscapes Golf Management was born. Today, LGM continues to build a robust infrastructure and high-performing team to support more than 60 properties across 24 states. Our Values Lead Do What's Right Find a Way Take Care of Each Other Be the Best OUR TEAM email Link Tom Everett President Tom Everett × Buoyed by more than 30 years in the golf business, Everett is responsible for Landscapes Golf Management’s success in operating more than 50 golf courses, country clubs, and resorts to client satisfaction.  A visionary, he continues to advance the company’s modern and innovative platform for business planning, recruiting, and training top talent, food, and beverage, clubhouse operations, merchandising, agronomy, national accounts, sales and marketing, technology, and financial management.  Everett is a PGA Professional who ascended the Landscapes Golf Management ranks, taking the reins as President in 2014.  He is lauded by golf industry cohorts for building an unbeatable culture that attracts passionate, energized, and intelligent professionals to contribute to successfully delivering on the company’s promises. email Link Mark Mattingly Executive Vice President Mark Mattingly × A 30-year, golf-industry executive, Mark Mattingly is Executive Vice President of Landscapes Golf Management, operator of more than 50 golf courses, country clubs, communities, and resorts across America.  His primary role is helping owners of golf properties formulate strategies toward achieving the objectives they set forth for their properties.  In addition to overseeing business development, Mattingly manages special projects and contributes to the overall strategic direction of the company.  During his career and with an aptitude for programming and membership development, he was General Manager, regional portfolio manager, and operations executive at daily-fee and private clubs.  Mattingly is a Class-A PGA Professional and was a longtime Board member of the Indiana PGA and member of the Club Management Association of America. email Link Mike Williams Senior Vice President Mike Williams × Mr. Williams provides leadership for all of our Regional Managers to ensure that leadership at Landscapes Golf Management is consistently striving to exceed our clients’ expectations on service delivery, achieving financial goals and facility development.  In addition to the aforementioned duties, Mike also maintains a small portfolio of managed properties under his direct supervision. An award-winning 20+ year member of the PGA of America, Mike came to Landscapes Golf Management from another well-known company where he served as a Regional Operations Executive and was responsible for supervising, managing and delivering positive, site-level operational, customer service and financial performance at more than a dozen properties with combined revenues exceeding $40M.  Mike works out of and travels from our regional office in Chicago, as well as maintaining a presence in our home office in Lincoln, NE.  In addition, Mike was just awarded the Illinois PGA Section inaugural Executive of the Year award. email Link Cesar Martinez Vice President - HR email Link Scot Wellman Vice President, Sales and Marketing Scot Wellman × Mr. Wellman is responsible for the strategic development and implementation of marketing and programming initiatives specifically tailored to drive revenue generation at the facility level. After spending ten years working in the analytics department for a Fortune 100 (Blue Chip) Company, Scot joined the team. Scot has been at the forefront of developing LGM’s industry-leading “Technology Stack.” The Stack allows LGM facilities to take advantage of cloud-based solutions which create automation, data aggregation/visualization, cost savings, and enhance the overall customer/member experience.  He works closely with field managers to drive impressions, build brand awareness, drive leads and create memorable experiences at all LGM facilities. Born the grandson of a Greens Superintendent, Scot’s introduction to the game he loves came early.  A member of the Nebraska Wesleyan Men’s Golf Team, and a NAIA conference champion, Scot was later named Head Golf Professional and held that role until 2006.  Scot always had a strong drive to increase member and guest interactions through programming, merchandising, and events.  Utilizing his B.A. in Business Administration (marketing), he excelled in his early golf operations career.  During his departure from the golf industry, Scot developed his skills in the areas of leadership, data analytics, completed staff work, lean essentials and driving results.  His combined experiences have made Scot a strong addition to the Landscapes Golf Management team in 2017. email Link Mark Young Vice President, Food and Beverage Operations Mark Young × Mr. Young supervises several Regional F&B Managers and together they are responsible for the oversight of 45 food and beverage operations around the country.  Mark is also responsible for negotiating and implementing national purchasing programs that offer the best pricing possible for all of our associated properties.  Realizing and generating revenue growth opportunities has been a vital role of the National Food and Beverage Director. Mark has implemented weekly and monthly reports to all Landscapes facilities that assist managers in controlling costs, labor and other expenses. Mr. Young has more than 25 years of experience in Food and Beverage management. Possessing comprehensive experience within the golf industry, Mark has an extensive working resume including roles as a course-level food and beverage manager, Regional Manager, and currently as the National Food & Beverage Director for the company.  He has experience and knowledge in all types of golf course food and beverage operations including; snack-bars, exhibition grills, back of the house kitchens, semi-private and private clubs.  In addition to operations, Mark has worked extensively on new construction projects as well as renovation projects saving clients thousands of dollars. email Link Brandon Wallraff Vice President, Operations Brandon Wallraff × Mr. Wallraff is responsible for operational oversight at private and public clubs within the Southwest region. Those duties would include but are not limited to; ongoing day to day management oversight, financial review and accountability, client relations and personnel development. Brandon has over ten years of experience in senior level management at public, private and resort golf and club facilities throughout the country.  He specializes and excels in turnaround and startup situations, and has exceptional skills in recruiting, training, business plan development, and implementation of operating procedures and service standards.  Brandon has completed a number of projects in the past, including the successful turnaround of distressed clubs in Omaha, Orlando, Tucson, Hawaii, Illinois and Nevada. email Link Chris Jacobson Vice President, Operations Chris Jacobson × Mr. Jacobson has been responsible for transitioning numerous Landscapes properties.  His focus lies in building quality teams, planning, budgeting, hiring and training management staff, developing/expanding facility and membership programming, all while improving products and services.   Chris works directly with the General Managers to implement annual business plans and operating budgets, while utilizing the Landscapes corporate team and support staff to achieve success. A Certified PGA Professional, Mr. Jacobson has over 25 years of experience in all facets of golf operations including daily-fee, semi-private, and private facilities.  Before transitioning to Landscapes Golf Management in 2011 as a Regional Operations Manager, he was the General Manager for The Players Club at Deer Creek; an Arnold Palmer-designed 27-hole private club located in Omaha, NE.  The Players Club continues to be one of the key flagship of the Landscapes Unlimited owned facilities and services over 900+ memberships annually. email Link Joe Goellner Vice President, Operations Joe Goellner × Mr. Goellner provides a single point of contact for our clients connecting the delivery of the onsite service team to the best practices, tools, and thought leadership of Landscapes’ expanded Regional/National support team. Joe works closely as a mentor with General Managers to implement annual business plans and operating budgets, as well as supporting the hiring/training of management staff, developing/expanding facility and membership programming, and improving products/services. RELEVANT EXPERIENCE A PGA Professional for more than a decade and holds a degree from the prestigious Rutgers University, Mr. Goellner has been a member of the Landscapes team since 2015. In his time serving as Assistant General Manager and General Manager at various LGM properties, Joe accumulated awards such as 2016 AGM of the Year, 2016 Ambassador of the Year, 2017 Innovator of the Year, and 2019 Facility of the Year. Joe most recently led a robust private club in NJ and oversaw the execution of a portion of their $14M Master Plan. email Link Chris Lewis Director, Agronomy Chris Lewis × Chris is the Director of Agronomy and Maintenance for Landscapes Golf Management. This includes overseeing the agronomic support, special projects, staffing, and capital needs at all LGM facilities with the support of the other Regional Superintendents. Chris is a Certified Golf Course Superintendent with over 23 years of experience in golf course agronomic practices.  He specializes in golf course maintenance, grown-in, and renovation projects.  Chris has spent time working at public, semi-private, and private facilities and has been an agronomic resource to the Landscapes Unlimited construction team on grown-in and renovation projects. email Link Austin Brown Director, Accounting and Finance email Link Rodney Strange Director of Safety email Link Rick Walrath Regional Leader email Link Justin Arlt Area Leader email Link Adam Brandow Manager of Training and Development Adam Brandow × Mr. Brandow is a trusted member of the Landscapes Golf Management team and joined our company in 2015.  In fact, Adam was part of the first class of external candidates hired to participate in our Assistant General Manager training program, with the express purpose of developing into a private club General Manager.  Since completing our training program, Adam has successfully served as General Manager, Transition Manager, and Regional Food & Beverage Manager.  Adam now supports the training and development of our dedicated team across the globe as our Manager of Training and Development. A PGA Professional since 2012, and graduate of Ferris State University (BS, Business), Adam has served as Assistant Golf Professional, Assistant General Manager, and General Manager at Private, Semi-Private, and Upscale Public facilities.  Adam also achieved a Master of Business Administration from Northwood University, Midland, MI.  As part of the Landscapes team, Adam will be available to deploy to a course to assist in executing General Manager duties while our leadership team performs an Executive Search to fulfill the full-time position of General Manager. email Link Tanner Stenson Manager, Select Accounting Tanner Stenson × Responsibilities Mr. Stenson supports the ten accounting staff members responsible for producing financial statements for over 40 clients throughout the Landscapes Golf Management portfolio. Tanner is also responsible for working closely with new LGM clients through the onboarding process as the company portfolio grows. Through his time at LGM, Tanner has led numerous process improvement projects ranging from accounting software integrations to budgeting tool creations. Relative Experience Mr. Stenson began working at Landscapes Golf Management during the summer of 2018 as a Staff Accountant before being promoted to Senior Accountant in 2020 and Accounting Supervisor in 2021. Before joining Landscapes Golf Management, he worked for Ag Processing, Inc in Omaha, Nebraska, where he held multiple roles in the Accounting and Finance Department. Ag Processing, Inc is a U.S. agribusiness with primary operations as a soybean processor/refiner. Mr. Stenson studied at the University of Nebraska – Omaha, where he earned his bachelor’s degree with a concentration in accounting. email Link Kenda Fink HR Compliance Specialist Kenda Fink × Ms. Fink provides human resource transition support to new clients and acquisitions including employee onboarding, job description development, and payroll and timekeeping configuration.  In addition, she provides guidance and coaching to field and corporate management on a variety of compliance concerns including the Affordable Care Act, FMLA and wage and hour issues.  Kenda currently serves as the compliance officer for the company’s Affirmative Action and EEO program. email Link Matt Fricke Accounting Supervisor email Link Amanda Tucker Recruitment Coordinator email Link Ross Judy Business Development Coordinator email Link Liz Uzdill Programs Coordinator email Link Murphy Klein Marketing Content Strategist email Link Kari Saville Senior Accountant email Link Diane Waters HR Generalist OUR PROPERTIES Your location Search radius 10 mi 25 mi 50 mi 100 mi 200 mi 500 mi Results 25 50 75 100 Full Management Marketing History Sales Mission & Vision Golf Operations Technology Our Team Food & Beverage Purchasing Contact Us Accounting Agronomy Blog Careers The Landscapes Family Landscapes Golf Management is proud to be part of the Landscapes Family of Companies. Founded in 1976, Landscapes is based in Lincoln, Nebraska, USA and regarded as the premier golf solutions provider in the world. The Landscapes Family of Companies is comprised of Landscapes Golf Management, founded over 30 years ago, and Landscapes Unlimited, nearly 50 years young and having completed more than 2,500 construction, renovation, development, irrigation projects. Together, the Landscapes Family of Companies have provided development and management services across the globe. Landscapes Golf Management 1201 Aries Drive Lincoln, Nebraska 68512 (402) 423-6653 info@landscapesgolf.com topbros.com Copyright Landscapes Golf Management

Contact Us - Meadows Golf Club Skip to primary navigation Skip to main content Skip to footer Meadows Golf Club Lincoln Park, NJ Phone: (973) 696-7212 | Join e-Club Home Tee Times Rates Meet the Staff Professional Golf Staff Golf Course Maintenance Staff Golfer Information & Policies Meadows Café Contact Us Liability Waiver Book Tee Times Contact Us Home Tee Times Rates Meet the Staff Professional Golf Staff Golf Course Maintenance Staff Golfer Information & Policies Meadows Café Contact Us Liability Waiver Contact Form Please enable JavaScript in your browser to complete this form. Subject: Name: Email: Phone: Message: Website Submit Meadows Golf Club 79 Two Bridges Road, Lincoln Park, NJ 07035 Phone: (973) 696-7212 Fax: (973) 696-4838 Email: mbilleci@meadowsgolflincolnpark.com and gcabalar@meadowsgolflincolnpark.com Directions From northern or southern New Jersey Take the Garden State Parkway to Route 80 West. Take Route 80 West to exit 52 THE CALDWELLS/LINCOLN PARK. Follow the off-ramp around to the stop sign, turn left and continue for a short distance over a small bridge. At the next stop sign turn left onto TWO BRIDGES ROAD. Continue for 1/2 a mile. THE MEADOWS GOLF CLUB will be on your right. Park and have a great game. From western New Jersey Take Route 80 East towards Parsippany, then take Route 46 East. Exit Route 46 East at FAIRFIELD/LINCOLN PARK, TWO BRIDGES ROAD exit. Turn left at the traffic light. Go to the next traffic light and turn left onto TWO BRIDGES ROAD. Follow TWO BRIDGES ROAD to the end. Turn left and continue for 1/2 a mile. THE MEADOWS GOLF CLUB will be on your right. Park and have a great game. If you get lost please give us a call because we don’t have an automated phone system and a Real Live Person will actually answer the call and help you find your way.
